fields.title: Add plugins/extension infrastructure
fields.body:
Gitblit would greatly benefit from plugin support. Extension points,
that are provided by GitBlit core are extended and the extension
is packaged as GitBlit plugin.

Such plugins can be put under ${baseFolder}/plugins and are loaded
during start of GitBlit. The extensions provided by plugins are dynamically
gathered and extends core feature.

A plugin defines their meta data in META-INF/MANIFEST.MF file:

Plugin-Class: com.gitblit.plugins.cookbook.CookbookPlugin
Plugin-Dependencies: foo, bar
Plugin-Id: gitblit-plugin
Plugin-Provider: John Doe
Plugin-Version: 1.0

Plugins can also defined extension points, that can be implemented
by other plugins defined by other plugins.

Plugins can depends on other plugins:

Plugin-Dependencies: foo, bar

By defining the plugin dependencies has following meaning:
during load phase, directed acyclic graph is built and the loading
order of plugins is reversed topological sorted: first parent then children.
Parent plugin classloader is combined classloader of all parent plugins.

Example for extension points:

* All request filter. Plugin that imlements this extension
can intercept all HTTP request: usual scenario for implementing
monitoring applications.
* Servlets
* SSH commands
* GIT hooks
* UI: pages, sections, ...

fields.title: Enhance the plugin infrastructure to allow deeper plugin integration
fields.body:
The basic plugin architecture was released in 1.5.0 but it is limited.  Enhance the extension points and core as needed to allow plugins to extend Gitblit in other areas.  This should include:

- A servlet filter for integrating monitoring solutions like JavaMelody
- An extension point for adding admin menu items
- An extension point for adding user menu items
- An extension point for adding top-level navigation items
- An extension point for adding repository-level navigation items
- Consider allowing a plugin to contribute an IManager
